ccre.net

Class Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.net.Network

  • public class Network
extends java.lang.Object
    The global Network handler. This contains a location to store the current network provider, and methods to interact with the provider, which will automatically detect the provider in many cases.
    Author:
    skeggsc

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ServerSocket bind(int port)
      Listen on the specified port, and return a ServerSocket representing the connection.
      static ClientSocket connect(java.lang.String targetAddress, int port)
      Connect to the specified IP address and port, and return a ClientSocket representing the connection.
      static ClientSocket connectDynPort(java.lang.String rawAddress, int default_port)
      This is like connect(targetAddress, port), but if the target address ends in a colon followed by a number, that port will be used instead of the specified port.
      static java.lang.String getPlatformType()
      Gets a string representing the platform type for this system.
      static NetworkProvider getProvider()
      Return the current network provider, finding it if it doesn't exist.

      Checks if the specified exception was thrown due to a timeout while reading from a socket.

    • Method Detail

      • getProvider

        public static NetworkProvider getProvider()
        Return the current network provider, finding it if it doesn't exist. This will look for ccre.net.DefaultNetworkProvider by default, and throw an exception if it doesn't exist.
        Returns:
        the active network Provider.

      • connect

        public static ClientSocket connect(java.lang.String targetAddress,
                   int port)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Connect to the specified IP address and port, and return a ClientSocket representing the connection.
        Parameters:
        targetAddress - the IP address to connect to.
        port - the port to connect to.
        Returns:
        the ClientSocket that represents the connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

      • connectDynPort

        public static ClientSocket connectDynPort(java.lang.String rawAddress,
                          int default_port)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        This is like connect(targetAddress, port), but if the target address ends in a colon followed by a number, that port will be used instead of the specified port.
        Parameters:
        rawAddress - the IP address to connect to, with an option port specifier.
        default_port - the default port to connect to if there is no port specifier.
        Returns:
        the ClientSocket that represents the connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs or the port specifier is invalid.

      • bind

        public static ServerSocket bind(int port)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Listen on the specified port, and return a ServerSocket representing the connection.
        Parameters:
        port - the port to listen on.
        Returns:
        the ServerSocket that represents the connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

      • listIPv4Addresses

        public static CCollection<java.lang.String> listIPv4Addresses()
        List all IPv4 addresses of the current system. This includes 127.0.0.1.
        Returns:
        a collection of the IPv4 addresses of the current system.

      • getPlatformType

        public static java.lang.String getPlatformType()
        Gets a string representing the platform type for this system. This is used by CluckNode to create a node ID.
        Returns:
        The platform type string.

      • isTimeoutException

        public static boolean isTimeoutException(java.io.IOException ex)
        Checks if the specified exception was thrown due to a timeout while reading from a socket.
        Parameters:
        ex - the IO exception to check
        Returns:
        if the exception was thrown due to a timeout.
